cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the Yucatán Channel into the central Gulf, then turning north-northwest toward the Louisiana Gulf Coast late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwest Louisiana coast (near Vermilion Bay to Cameron Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches are yet in effect (current watches/warnings confined to Cuba and the Yucatán Peninsula).
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings are yet in effect (current warnings confined to Cuba and the Yucatán Peninsula).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coast eastward to western Alabama is shown in the day-4/5 portion of the cone, with highest risk along southwest and south-central Louisiana.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) appear possible by late Thursday night or Friday; a 14% chance exists for 58-mph (50-kt) winds in the 5-day window.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Given projected Category-2+ intensity over the north-central Gulf, surge of at least 3–5 ft above ground level is plausible along Calcasieu and Cameron Parishes, including the Lake Charles ship channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: Model consensus supports 4–8 inches with locally higher totals as Delta slows after landfall, producing flash-flood potential over southwest Louisiana.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands beginning late Thursday night; prolonged port access disruption from debris, high water, and power outages.
